tagline: Spans code review, testing, security, performance, and accessibility — finds what's broken before users do
pros: Cross-domain quality perspective — sees how a performance fix can introduce a security hole or break accessibility
Builds test automation and integrates security scanning into CI, catching issues before they reach review
Audits accessibility with real assistive technology, not just automated scanners
Documents every finding with severity, reproduction steps, and suggested fix — never just 'this is broken'
cons: Breadth across quality disciplines means less depth than a dedicated security researcher or performance engineer
Thorough reviews take time — can be a bottleneck in fast-moving sprints
Doesn't do formal penetration testing or red-team exercises — those need dedicated security specialists

model_recommendations.notes: Complex reasoning, architecture, security, or financial analysis. Needs the best available model with full thinking/reasoning enabled.
